newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt watching Israel for effects on peace.
newsitem.headline: Egypt watching Israel for effects on peace.

text.p: Egypt said on Monday it was watching events in Israel for any implications they might have for Middle East peace talks.
Egyptian Foreign Amr Moussa was answering a question on the decision on Sunday not to prosecute Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on corruption charges.
"We are following the situation. This is an internal matter on which we have no comment and our only interest is in the aspect relating to the peace process," he said.
Moussa added that any successful attempt to save Middle East peace talks would have to tackle the question of Jewish settlements and faithful implementation of agreements.
"All the parties, especially Israel, must respect the foundations on which agreement was reached. Without that the situation will grow worse," he said.
"Security must be for everyone, not just for one party as Israel is now demanding.".
